sentence.Network_en: If l wasn't tone - deaf, l'd have a very good voice.
sentence.Network_cn: 如果不是因为跑调, 我唱歌还是不错的.

sentence.Network_en: Dee: Never mind , why do not you try learning the drums? Then being tone - deaf shouldn't matter.
sentence.Network_cn: 迪伊: 这不要紧.你为什么不改学打鼓 呢 ?学打鼓,音盲大概也不要紧.

sentence.Network_en: "I know you," he said flatly, matter-of-fact, neutral in tone.
sentence.Network_cn: “我认识你。”他平淡地说道，就事论事，不带任何感情。

entry.tran: 不能辨别音调的;音盲的；五音不全的
entry.def: If you say that someone is tone-deaf, you mean that they cannot sing in tune or recognize different tunes.
